    • Method Detail

      • createRating

        public void createRating(Map<String,Object> params,
                ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<RatingResponse>> callback)
        This is used to leave rating on a ratable object (i.e. retailer locations). Each user can only rate on a ratable object once per category. If a user rates on the same object and category, the previous rating will be overwritten. Leaving a rating on a ratable object will be visible to everyone who has access to view the object.

        Target API Endpoint: /rating/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The unique accountId that made the request (either deviceId or accountId must be used, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.ratableType
          The ratable object type {RETAILER_LOCATION}
        • SirqulKeys.ratableId
          The id of the ratable object
        • SirqulKeys.ratingValue
          The integer value of 0-255
        • SirqulKeys.categoryId
          the category id
        • SirqulKeys.locationDescription
          The description of the location
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          The current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        WrappedResponse<RatingResponse> on success, SirqulResponse on failure
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        RatingApiBase.createRating

      • deleteRating

        public void deleteRating(Map<String,Object> params,
                ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Sets a rating as deleted.

        Target API Endpoint: /rating/delete

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The unique accountId that made the request (either deviceId or accountId must be used)
        • SirqulKeys.ratingId
          The ID of the rating to delete

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

      • searchLocationRatingIndexes

        public void searchLocationRatingIndexes(Map<String,Object> params,
                               ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<RatingIndexResponse>> callback)
        Search for retailer locations by averages near you.

        Target API Endpoint: /location/rating/index/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          Comma separated list of category ids to filter the results by
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The column to sort the search on {ID, CREATED, UPDATED, ACTIVE, RATABLE_TYPE, RATABLE_ID, RATABLE_DISPLAY, CATEGORY_ID, CATEGORY_NAME, CATEGORY_SHORT_NAME, CATEGORY_DISPLAY, COUNT, SUMMATION, AVERAGE, VALUE}
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          The order to return the search results
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The record to begin the return set on
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The number of records to return
        • SirqulKeys.searchRange
          The search radius in kilometers to filter results
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user
        • SirqulKeys.returnOverallRating
          Determines whether to return the overall rating record instead

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse<RatingIndexResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        RatingApiBase.searchLocationRatingIndexes(...)

      • searchRatingIndexes

        public void searchRatingIndexes(Map<String,Object> params,
                       ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<RatingIndexResponse>> callback)
        Search for ratable items by averages.

        Target API Endpoint: /rating/index/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.ratableType
          Filter results by a ratable type {RETAILER_LOCATION}
        • SirqulKeys.ratableIds
          Comma separated list of ratable ids to filter the resuts by
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          Comma separated list of category ids to filter the results by
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The column to sort the search on {ID, CREATED, UPDATED, ACTIVE, RATABLE_TYPE, RATABLE_ID, RATABLE_DISPLAY, CATEGORY_ID, CATEGORY_NAME, CATEGORY_SHORT_NAME, CATEGORY_DISPLAY, COUNT, SUMMATION, AVERAGE, VALUE}
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          The order to return the search results
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The record to begin the return set on
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The number of records to return

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse<RatingIndexResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.

      • searchRatings

        public void searchRatings(Map<String,Object> params,
                 ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<RatingResponse>> callback)
        Search for ratings on a ratable object.

        Target API Endpoint: /rating/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.ratableType
          The ratable object type {RETAILER_LOCATION}
        • SirqulKeys.ratableId
          The id of the ratable object
        • SirqulKeys.categoryIds
          Comma separated list of category ids to filter the results by
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The column to sort the search on {ID, CREATED, UPDATED, ACTIVE, OWNER_DISPLAY, RATABLE_TYPE, RATABLE_ID, RATABLE_DISPLAY, CATEGORY_ID, CATEGORY_NAME, CATEGORY_SHORT_NAME, CATEGORY_DISPLAY, VALUE}
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          The order to return the search results
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The record to begin the return set on
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The number of records to return

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse<RatingResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:

        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call.       • updateRating

        public void updateRating(Map<String,Object> params,
                ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<RatingResponse>> callback)
        Update an existing rating. Only the creator of the rating have permission to update.

        Target API Endpoint: /rating/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The unique accountId that made the request (either deviceId or accountId must be used)
        • SirqulKeys.ratingId
          The id of the rating (Note: this is not the ratable object id)
        • SirqulKeys.ratingValue
          The rating value to update
        • SirqulKeys.categoryId
          the category id
        • SirqulKeys.locationDescription
          The description of the location
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          The current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        WrappedResponse<RatingResponse> on success, SirqulResponse on failure
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        RatingApiBase.updateRating
